dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Apple, Meta Platforms rise to lead 'Magnificent 7' stocks amid AI washout
News Content: Apple (AAPL) and Meta Platforms (META) stock both jumped more than 2% on Monday, bucking the trend of their Magnificent Seven peers and providing some respite for tech investors amid a steep sell-off in AI and related names following the release of Chinese firm DeepSeek's new cost-effective AI model.

In an email on Monday, DA Davidson analyst Gil Luria told Yahoo Finance, "Apple is reacting positively to the DeepSeek news because smaller more efficient models means it will be able to have better AI products in the iPhone."

Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Friday said the company would spend as much as $65 billion this year on AI investments. The company has been working on building its own AI model, Llama, and DeepSeek's breakthrough shows possible efficiency gains available to future LLMs.Source: Yahoo Finance

Companies being hit hardest on Monday, most notably Nvidia, make AI chips that power these models.

Last week, DeepSeek released an AI model competitive with OpenAI’s last week, putting it at the top of Apple’s app store.

•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Venture capitalist Marc Andreessen wrote in a post on X Jan. 24 that DeepSeek's latest R1 model is "one of the most amazing and impressive breakthroughs I’ve ever seen." Apple also offers ChatGPT on its latest iPhone.

The reported cost to train one of its latest models was just $5.6 billion, far below OpenAI’s more than $100 million in spending to train GPT-4 — prompting concern among the investment community that hyperscalers are severely over investing in AI infrastructure.

Nvidia (NVDA) and Broadcom (AVGO) led chip stocks down, while the tech heavy Nasdaq dropped 2.6%. Hyperscalers Microsoft (MSFT), Google (GOOG), and Amazon (AMZN) also fell.DeepSeek app on an iPhone. (Photo by GREG BAKER / AFP) (Photo by GREG BAKER/AFP via Getty Images)·GREG BAKER via Getty Images

Even with Apple stock’s rise Monday, shares are still down 12% from last month as AI smartphones and PCs struggle to gain traction.

The stock was hit with two downgrades last week from Jefferies and Loop Capital amid its struggling iPhone sales. Apple is set to report earnings after the bell Jan. 30. The majority of analysts tracked by Yahoo Finance recommend buying the stock and see shares rising to $246 over the next 12 months.

Laura Bratton is a reporter for Yahoo Finance. Follow her on Bluesky @laurabratton.bsky.social. Email her at laura.bratton@yahooinc.com.

Click here for the latest technology news that will impact the stock market

Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.

Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: Apple's stock has seen a recent jump of over 2% despite a broader market sell-off in technology stocks related to AI. This is largely attributed to positive sentiment about its ability to develop better AI products due to competition from DeepSeek's cost-effective AI models. Analyst support remains strong, with a majority recommending buy, anticipating a rise in the stock price over the next year. However, recent downgrades and a 12% decline in the last month highlight existing concerns about iPhone sales. Balancing these factors, the probability of a price rise seems higher due to positive reactions and future growth potential, while the risk of a fall is mitigated but not entirely absent given recent downgrades and market volatility.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed picture for Apple (AAPL). Positive factors include: 1) The stock rose 2% on Monday, bucking the trend of other "Magnificent Seven" stocks amidst an AI sell-off. 2) An analyst suggests that smaller, more efficient AI models (like DeepSeek's) could benefit Apple's iPhone AI products. 3) Even venture capitalist Marc Andreessen sees significance in DeepSeek's recent launch. 4) Analyst Buy ratings for AAPL give a target of $246. Negative factors include: 1) The overall negative sentiment towards AI investments in the broader market could affect Apple. 2) Shares remain down 12% from last month, suggesting a weaker near-term trend. 3) Recent downgrades from Jefferies and Loop Capital citing struggling iPhone sales is also not good. 4) Upcoming earnings report Jan. 30. Given the mixed factors, a slight upward momentum might be expected. Given the good stock movement that day and the analyst's comments, there is reason to believe that AI can make more favorable products for Apple. However, there is evidence to show the iPhone sales aren't great, and the overall AI market investment sentiment is currently negative. With the factors considered, the probabilities are based on the relatively good news, a slightly-better-than-even rising stock price move is predicted.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: Apple's stock price rose 2% following news of DeepSeek's cost-effective AI model. This is because a more efficient AI model benefits Apple by enabling the creation of better AI products for the iPhone, potentially boosting sales.  The analyst quote directly supports this positive outlook.  However, counteracting this positive news are recent downgrades due to struggling iPhone sales and the overall uncertainty surrounding AI investments given DeepSeek's breakthrough.  While the positive news is impactful in the short term, the longer-term uncertainty related to iPhone sales and the broader AI market warrants caution.  Therefore, while the probability of a rise is higher due to the immediate positive reaction, the inherent risk factors mean the probability isn't overwhelmingly high.
